name: Menzies' Fiddleneck, Small flowered fiddleneck
overview: As an annual herb, it completes its life cycle in the course of the year. Because they can be toxic to animals (animals will not eat them), they are very commonly found. It flowers and germinates in the spring, and there is a subspecies that even self-pollinates. Blooms from March to May and is not endangered
habitat: It is native to California yet can be found throughout most of North America. It is commonly found along roadsides, fields, and other dry open places.  It also prefers meadows, vernal pools, and shrub-steppes
tags: yellow green flower grass Plant Amsinckia Menziesii Menzies' Fiddleneck plants
